page.title: 12SERBIAN CHURCH,TELFORD.
page.content: The Serbian community originally came from Yugoslavia.They left their native country during World War II when Yugo- slavia was occupied by the Germans and did not return because a communist dictatorship took over.The Serbians needed a church and national centre of their own and in 1966 - 67 bought the Methodist Church,Donnington.The church was altered inside to suit the tradit- ions of the orthodox faith and was furnished with a new altar and holy ikons.Bishop Dinisya, the head of the Serbian church outside Yugoslavia,came from Chicago to consecrate the church in 1968.According to the Orthodox faith, a church must have a bell-tower The building of tower was financed by the Serbian community and the bell donated by the Church of St.Nicholas, Newport.There are few full services as the serving priest lives in Halifax.
